answers.answer: Have you been tested for diabetes? I have a friend who developed gout and she was tested since it can be a symptom, and it turns out she does have diabetes..  On a different note, I have severe arthritis in my big toe.  I have a lump at the base, just like you.  Several years ago, I believe I broke it (but never went to dr).  So now I have arthritis in it.  It comes and goes, and the pain can be quite severe (to the point that walking is very difficult).  From what I've read, if it's gout, it will be red and swollen, and affects the joint nearest the tip of the toe.  If it's arthritis, it doesn't get red, warm or necessarily swollen, just painful and it affects the joint at the base of the toe.  I hope you find out what's causing it.  Good luck!

question: This last week I developed a sudden and severe pain in my big toe.  The swelling extended to the top of my foot at the base of my big toe.  It hurt so bad that just sitting it was throbbing.  I thought maybe I had sprained it or something during a walk or jog.  it was so bad I could not sleep.  I went to my podiatrist who did x-rays but said the bones were fine.  She said it was gout.  I have been reading on this and it all points to obesity as a cause.  I have been working very hard since last July and have lost 56 pound and I am eating better than ever and also exercising regularly.  I have been on a high protien low carb diet.  I still have weight to lose but not as much as I have already lost.  It was kind of a blow to me to think I am now suffering from this due to obesity when I have been working so hard.  Could there be another cause?  I was given Indocin (sp) and it made me very sick.  I also was given vicodin which helped the pain but dropped my heart rate very low.  That was over the weekend as I saw the doctor on Friday.  I have not had any meds since Sat. because it made me so sick.  I tried to call today for different meds but couldn't get through yet.  How important is it to get other medication?  The toe is still swollen and sore but not like it was!!
title: Is it gout?
